text: The Calvary Episcopal Church', at 9 N. Villard Ave. in Red Lodge, Montana, was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1986. It is an east- facing one-story gable-front frame church with a projecting gabled vestibule. It has a wing extending to the north. It was built in 1900 by carpenters E.S. Donnell and B.B. Baker. With . ==References== Category:National Register of Historic Places in Montana Category:Churches completed in 1900 Category:Carbon County, Montana
title: Calvary Episcopal Church (Red Lodge, Montana)
